intro: Guiera glandulosa, commonly known as the African wild bean, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It features compound leaves with serrated edges and small, glandular structures on its stems and leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by pods containing edible seeds. It is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, often found in savannas and woodland areas. The species is valued for its nutritional seeds and traditional medicinal uses.
